conversations.content: With Halloween season in full swing once again, the Halidom's denizens decided to mark the occasion by holding a celebration with the locals.
Trick or treat! I hope you brought candy, because otherwise I'll have to eeeeat your braaaaaains...
Oh, what an adorable little zombie! Here's a gumdrop, dear.
Mom? What's a zombie?
A zombie is a dead person who comes back to life and crawls out of the grave.
People come back when they're dead?!
Oh, I'm sorry. Did I frighten you?
There's really nothing to worry about; this is just a fun Halloween costume! I'm not ACTUALLY a zombie.
I suppose it's difficult for one of her age to make that sort of distinction.
Are you...Emilia?
I'm sorry?
YOU ARE! YAAAAAY!
Anna, stop that at once! This isn't your sister.
YES IT IS! IT'S HER!
*sigh* Oh, Anna...
Forgive me, ma'am, but who exactly does your daughter think I am?
I'm so sorry. She had an older sister who passed away and... Well, I suppose she thinks you are her.
Do we look alike?
A similar height and build, but that's it. Frankly, you're not even the same race.
Yes, I was wondering about that. Er, so then, why does she...?
She's never really been able to accept my Emilia's death.
I think she understands in her head, but in her heart...
At home, she'll suddenly get up and go looking for Emilia until she remembers that she's gone. Then come the tears...
How simply heartbreaking.
Why do you look so sad, Sis? Are you okay? Does your tummy hurt?
Er, n-no! I'm fine! No hurt tummy here!
Yay! Then c'mon, let's go home.
Whoa, hold up! Sweetie, I'm really sorry, but I'm not your sister!
But you're a zombie, right?
Well, I'm DRESSED as a zombie, but—
I knew it! You ARE Emilia! You came back for me!
(Oh, this is just so sad. How am I going to fix things with this poor girl...?)
(Ah! Of course!)
Listen. Zombies are like ghosts, all right? They're dead bodies that still move around.
But YOU are a living human, which means the two of us can't stay togeth—
NOOOOO!
Ah!
I don't care if you're a dead zombie! I wanna stay with yooooou!
You really miss her, don't you?
Oh dear. I know this is terribly improper, but might you come live with us and pretend to be her sister?
What?!
Then you want me to lie to her? Will that really help anything?
I know how mad it sounds, but I think the poor child needs her sister's help to heal.
Please, I beg of you: Just for a little while, until her heart is whole again.
...All right. If I can be of help, I'll do all that I'm able.
I don't have the words to thank you.
Isn't that nice, Anna? Your sister is going to be with us again!
YAAAAAAY! Let's play a whole lot, just like we did before!
O-of course we will, uh, Anna...
(I'm not certain I make a convincing sister, but I'll do what I can.)
(This is something only a zombie could do for her, so I must make it count!)
Er, thank you for having me.
No! That's not what you say, Emilia! You're s'posed to say, ＂I'm home.＂
Oh. Right. Uh...I'm home?
Yay! Welcome home, Sis!
You haven't been back in a long, long time, so what do you think? Did you miss it?
Um...I don't really...
Wait, did you forget about home?
Sweetie, she was asleep in her grave for all those months, remember? You need to give her a little more time to wake up.
Y-yes! That's right...um...Mom!
Hee hee! You're such a sleepyhead, Emilia!
OH! Wait right there, 'kay? I've got the perfect thing!
Thank you for the assist there.
It's the least I can do, after dragging you into this mad scheme.
Hrrrf... Rrrgh... PHEW! Here, Emilia! I brought it for you!
Uh, that's a SPEAR.
You used to practice with it every morning, 'member? It's how you woke up.
Now do the spinny move! I wanna see the spinny move!
Er, you want me to...spin the...spear?
(Sounds like Emilia was quite athletic.)
(Problem is, I am most certainly NOT. How am I ever going to fake this?)
You mean her spear dance, honey? Yes, Emilia WAS really good at that, huh? But, um, now that she's a zombie...
R-right! Zombies can't move very fast, so I don't think ＂spear dancing＂ is going to be possible for...quite some time.
Aw, you can't do the spinny move? That makes me sad...
Well, maybe there's something else I can do that doesn't require so much...talent?
Perhaps we could play house. Do you feel like playing, Anna?
YEAH! I wanna play house with you!
Zzz...
She's finally down.
Dear thing played herself to sleep.
Love you, Emilia... Zzzzzz...
I really can't thank you enough, Melsa. She hasn't been this happy in months.
I'm just glad she's feeling better. Er, but if you don't mind my asking, do you think I'm doing an okay job of...all this?
You've been wonderful—especially with playing house. She and Emilia used to play that game all the time.
She was so good with Anna. So caring. Why did that disease have to choose her?
I'm so sorry for your loss.
*sniff* I'm sorry, dear. You shouldn't have to listen to me get all maudlin.
I'm going to take this one to bed.
So Emilia was kind as well as athletic.
In that case, I'm going to make this work!
Hah! Yah! Raaah! ...Phew! This spear workout is no joke.
(Maybe I'm going about this all wrong. I mean, there's no reason to push myself to do things I can't just to be a more convincing Emilia.)
(What matters here is helping Anna heal, which means being nice to her is the most important thing I can do.)
Aw, you can't do the spinny move? That makes me sad...
(But Emilia adored her little sister. If she'd seen the look on her face, she would have done whatever it took to make her happy again.)
(And now that job falls on me!)
HAH! YAH! RAAAH!
Some days later...
You can do the spinny move again?!
Er, Emilia? Are you certain you're not pushing yourself too hard here?
I'm fine, thank you. Now please stand back and permit me to show you.
Okay, here we go... YAH!
Shah! Haaah!
Raaagh!
WHOA! That was soooo cool! You're the awesomest, Emilia!
She really is, isn't she?
I never thought I'd see that spear dance again. Thank you so much, dear.
It's almost as if Emilia really had come back to us...
Hee hee! You're so silly, Mom. She DID come back to us!
Yes, Anna. Of course she did.
I sure did!
Now, we have another whole day to play together, so what should we do first?!
Zzz... Hnrf? Emilia? Where are you?!
No... Don't leave me!
Mmmn? Anna?
Emilia!
You're still here!
Don't worry, sweetie. Your big sis isn't going anywhere; I'll always be right here at your side, okay?
Now go back to bed.
Thanks, Emilia... I'm not lonely anymore...
Zzzzzz...
(Poor Anna woke up crying again.)
(On the surface, she seems better, but you can tell her heart's still hurting.)
(Maybe what I'm doing isn't enough.)
(I need to work harder to make sure she never feels lonely again!)
Owwww... WAAAAAAAAH! Emiliaaaa, heeeelp!
Anna, are you all right?! Can you stand?!
*sniffle* It hurts and I can't walk.
Can I have a piggyback?
One express horsey ride home, coming up!
Yaaaaay!
Dinner time, girls.
Blech! Carrots and peppers are GROSS.
You can have mine, Emilia! Eat them all up for me, 'kay?
What? You shouldn't be picky, Anna...
...Oh, all right. But just this once!
Yaaay! I love you soooo much!
And so the days passed with Melsa ever at Anna's side. Until finally...
Morning, Emilia! Morning, Mom!
Good morning, honey.
Morning, Anna.
(She slept through the night without waking up in tears this entire week.)
(It seems like her scars really are beginning to heal.)
(My role here is coming to an end...)
(Which means it's time to end this and let both of us go back to our real lives.)
Yah! Hrah! ...Gah?! I lost my grip!
Whoa! You messed up the spinny move?!
I did, huh. Isn't that funny?
(Now that she's had time to heal, she may be ready to accept her sister's death.)
(But if I just throw the truth in her face, the shock could do terrible damage.)
(If possible, I'd like to lead her to learning the truth on her own.)
Pretty weird, huh, Anna? It turns out I may not be that good with a spear after all.
Ah! Emilia, are you...?
Are you not feeling good?! Did you catch a bad cold again?!
Er, no. I... That isn't what I—
MOOOM! Come quick! It's Emilia!
(Perhaps that was a bit too subtle.)
(I'll have to make my next hint a touch easier to follow.)
Here, Emilia! If you've got a fever, you gotta put ice on your forehead!
Thank you—oh, but not the forehead. A little higher up, please.
Huh? Higher up?
That's right. Would you set the ice right on the top of my head?
Okay! ...Huh? It won't stay. Your big dumb ears are in the...
That's right—I have great big ears coming out of the top of my head! You don't have big ears like mine, do you, Anna?
Isn't that funny? We're sisters, so why would we be different?
Your ears... Your ears are...
SOOOO CUTE! You look like a bunny! I wish I had big ears like you!
What?!
I want to grow my own pair of bunny ears! Show me how! Show me, show meeeee!
Er, that's not really... Um...
And so Melsa's attempts to guide Anna to the truth continued apace.
No luck today, either.
I guess that just leaves the final option: Telling her the truth in plain language.
It feels so cruel to hurt her like that when she's just starting to feel better.
Oh, but this is simply awful. What am I going to do?
Hello, Anna? Might we talk? It's...important.
Sure, Emilia! Whatcha wanna talk about?
Er, right. Phew! Okay then...
Oh, can I sit on your lap while we talk?!
Er, of course...
Yaaay!
Okay, I'm all comfy now. What's up?
Well, it's... You see, I need to...
I need to ask you if you want me to read you another picture book!
Ooo, yes! Can we pleeease?!
*sigh* Well, THAT was an utter disaster. I promised myself today was the day I would finally tell her the truth...
But when I see that trusting smile and those eyes, it's like a dagger being thrust straight through my heart.
It gives me flashbacks to Sarisse and the prince; I was so scared of betraying them, I couldn't get the truth out.
I wish I'd been able to be honest back then and ask for help instead of hiding...
...Hold on. I CAN ask for help!
I bet her mother has an idea how I can get Anna to realize I'm not her sister!
I'm sure she knows her own daughter a lot better than a stranger like me does!
Why didn't I think of this sooner?!
...So that's where I'm stuck.
I've tried to get it across to her a bunch of different ways these last few days, but I've had no luck so far.
What do you think I could do to help her understand that I'm not really her sister?
This may just be my worry talking, but...
Anna might not be ready to accept Emilia's death quite yet.
In the sense that her emotional scars still have yet to heal?
But she's calmed down so much the last few weeks—she hasn't woken up crying in the middle of the night once!
It's true she's all smiles these days.
And that's all thanks to you, Melsa. You put her broken heart back together.
I'm glad I could help, but with that being the case, why do you think she isn't ready?
See, Anna and Emilia were close, but their relationship wasn't exactly perfect.
Before she died, Emilia told me she regretted being so overprotective of Anna.
She did?!
She was so excited to have a baby sister, and she just loved Anna to bits.
But because of that, she did everything for her—including the things Anna needed to learn to do for herself.
Before either of us realized it, Anna had grown into someone who couldn't manage life on her own terms.
Ah, I see. I noticed she was a bit clingy, but had chalked it up to grief.
The fault is mine as much as Emilia's; I spoiled the child a great deal.
I told myself it was a good thing they were so close, which let me ignore the problem.
But eventually it got bad enough that the two of us had to acknowledge it.
Emilia was ready to step back and let Anna finally learn some independence, but then she took ill and...
It must have been so hard to leave her sister right when she was about to help her make her own way in the world.
...I think it's this unhealthy dependence that has blocked Anna from accepting her sister's death.
I see...
Well, if Emilia wanted to instill some independence in Anna, then I'll simply have to do it in her place!
Because right now, I'm her big sister!
You're a terribly sweet girl, but it wouldn't be right to drag you any deeper into my family's problems.
Especially when it would mean forcing you to be the bad guy—Anna's not going to learn without some tough love, you know.
There's no guarantee she wouldn't just come to resent you instead of forging out on her own like you want.
That's true—and I'd be lying if I said it's not scary to think of someone who's become like a real little sister hating me.
Which is why I can't ask you to—
But! No one ever solved a relationship problem by putting it off out of fear of upsetting the other person.
I've made that mistake myself, in the past. I was so afraid some very dear friends might come to hate me...
But kicking that can down the road only wound up making more trouble for everyone in the end.
So this time, I'm not running away. Instead, I'm going face this problem head-on and deal with it!
Melsa...
Well, if you're committed, I'd be eternally grateful if you could help her learn to stand on her own two feet.
And I know you'd help Emilia rest easy, what with finishing the thing she never had the chance to start.
Leave it to me.
Emilia's regrets. Anna's grief.
It's time to put an end to both of their sadness and let this family move on!
Okay, Anna. Dinnertime.
Ewww... Carrots and peppers are gross.
You can have mine, Emilia! Eat them just like always, 'kay? Pleeeease?
Hmmmm...
I'm sorry, Anna, but you're going to have to eat those by yourself.
But...I said please!
Do you hate me? *sniff*
I only hate bad little girls who won't eat their veggies. Are you one of those?
What?! N-no! Please don't hate me!
Then let's see you gobble up all those veggies. Because if you don't...
O-okay, I'll eat 'em! I'll eat 'em right now!
(I feel like a monster for threatening you, Anna, but it's the only way you'll learn.)
I... *sniffle* I hate carrots and peppers. *nibble* Blech.
*nibble* Hmm. Actually, these are kinda yummy? *chomp*
(You're being a real champ, Anna.)
(You've got this—and I think I've got this as well.)
Owie! *sniff* WAAAAAH!
Emilia, heeelp! It hurts too bad to walk...
Aww, it looks like you skinned your knee there, kiddo. But you're okay—a little scrape like that won't stop you.
No, I really can't walk! It huuuurts!
You really can't? Even though you're the strongest little girl I know?
...Am I really strong?
Much more than you know, Anna.
Really? B-but, um...
Even if you don't believe it yet, I do.
You...believe in me?
I do. Now up we go! Get back on those big strong legs all by yourself!
'Kay, I'll try!
Look at that! You did it all on your own! Now do you believe me when I say you're super strong?
Hee hee! I guess I AM pretty strong...
Stern in one moment and nurturing the next, Melsa fostered Anna's independence— and in time, her efforts bore fruit...
Emilia! Mom! I'm gonna go play with my friends outside!
Ah!
Ha ha! I fell! What a doof.
But it's okay! I'm super strong!
I think she might finally be ready to leave her sister's side.
I think so, too. Thank you so much, Melsa.
Now BOTH of us are ready to move on, as a family.
And I hope...I hope Emilia can rest easy knowing she has no unfinished business to worry about.
...Oh, that reminds me. Melsa: I was wondering if you'd want to visit her grave. I think she'd really like to meet you.
Of course. But first, I need to return her name so I can meet her as my own self.
And that means telling Anna the truth.
Um, so what'd you wanna talk about all the way out here, Emilia?
It's something very important.
Anna, sweetie... I'm not your big sister.
Huh? What do you mean?
My name is Melsa. Not Emilia.
Mel...sa? But you're STILL Emilia, right?
Because you're a zombie. You came back to life and you're my sister.
I'm only dressed up as a zombie, honey. It's just pretend—not real.
But then where's Emilia?!
Emilia is sleeping in her grave. She has been ever since she died.
No... No! I don't want that! It's so lonely when she's gone! I miss her so... *sniff*
Don't cry, Anna. You're strong, remember?
But... But...
No buts. You can eat all your veggies, you can walk off a skinned knee, and you can go play with friends all by yourself.
That's how strong you are—and that's why you'll be all right even if your big sister isn't there to help you.
You're going to get through life just fine, because that's what strong girls do.
Even if I'm all by myself?!
You've got this! Up on your feet, Anna! You can do this on your own!
(Melsa's not my sister for real, but she's cheering me on like she is.)
(She said nice things to me like Emilia always did, and it made me really happy.)
(So I want to try to be like she says. I wanna do things on my own.)
Okay. I'll try. Even if I'm on my own, I'll still try really hard.
And you're going to do GREAT, Anna, because I know how strong you are.
Hee hee! Thanks, Melsa. Hearing that from you makes me feel way better.
I'll be okay as long as you're with me!
Sweetie, I'm sorry, but... I can't do that. I have my own family back at the Halidom that I have to return to.
Oh. Right. If you're not really my sister, then I guess you can't stay.
*sniff* It's gonna be lonely on my own...
But I'm not gonna cry, because I'm strong!
You really are, Anna. And though we only got a little while together, I'm very proud to have been your big sis.
Hee hee! Thanks, Melsa.
I'm glad I got to be with you, too.
So, um...bye! And, er...take care?
I have one last lesson for you, Anna: the perfect words for times like these.
(Right, Sarisse? When you have to part with people you love, it's not goodbye.)
Huh? What are they?
See you later.
There's no rule that says we can never meet again, so you can come play at the Halidom whenever you like!
Yaaaaaay! I'm totally gonna do that!
See you later, Sis!
